result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Levi L Johnson

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

9:43 AM cases 20CM760, 21CM782, 21CM897, 22CM77, 22CM703 called. Defendant Levi L Johnson in court.  Attorney David Czech in court for Levi L Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
There is an agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
In 22TR220: Defendant pleads No Contest to OWI 1st. 
In 20CM760: The DAGP is vacated and defendant is found Guilty of Count 1: Pointing a Firearm at Another. 
In 21CM782: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Carrying a Concealed Weapon. 
Court accepts pleas and finds defendant Guilty on all counts and vacates the DAGP agreement. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
As to the OWI 1st: Court orders defendant to pay $811.50 (fine + costs) and the Mayo Blood Draw Fee. 
Defendant's driver's license is revoked for 6 months and defendant to complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 

As to Count 1 in 20CM760 and Count 2 in 21CM782: 
Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 2 years with conditions: 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant to pay court costs including DNA sample surcharge. 
Defendant has 1 day credit if revoked from Probation. 
Probation can end after one year if probation agent deems it appropriate.
